snippet: Hamid Aboutalebi, who was to become Iran’s ambassador to the United Nations in July, was a member of the Muslim student group that took American hostages in 1979.
abstract: Senate votes unanimously to bar Hamid Aboutalebi, Iran's newly named ambassador to the United Nations, from entering the United States, charging that he was involved in the hostage-taking at the United States Embassy in Tehran in 1979.
lead_paragraph: Hamid Aboutalebi, who was to become Iran’s ambassador to the United Nations in July, was a member of the Muslim student group that took American hostages in 1979.

headline.main: Iran’s Choice for U.N. Post Denied Entry Into the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Choice for U.N. Post Denied Entry Into the U.S.
